TextView.android:text: Thought Record Statistics
Step One: Describe the Upsetting Event
Step Two: Record Your Negative Feelings
Rate each one from 0 (the least) to 100 (the most). Fill in at least one row, and at most six rows.
Step Three: Automatic Thoughts
Write the negative thoughts that come to mind automatically. How much do you believe in them?
Step Four: Distortions
Identify the cognitive distortions in your automatic thoughts.
ALL-OR-NOTHING THINKING
You look at things in absolute, black-and-white categories.
You view a negative event as a never-ending pattern of defeat.
MENTAL FILTER
You dwell on the negatives and ignore the positives.
DISCOUNTING THE POSITIVES
You insist that your accomplishments or positive qualities don\'t count.
JUMPING TO CONCLUSIONS
You assume that people are reacting negatively to you when there\'s no evidence, or you arbitrarily predict that things will turn out badly.
MAGNIFICATION / MINIMIZATION
You blow things way out of proportion, or you shrink their importance.
EMOTIONAL REASONING
You feel some way, so you think that it\'s the truth automatically.
SHOULD STATEMENTS
You criticize yourself or others with \'ought-to\' statements
You turn mistakes into personal shortcomings.
PERSONALIZING THE BLAME
You think something is your fault when it isn\'t, or you blame someone for something you\'re responsible for.
Step Five: Rational Responses
Knowing your distortions, re-evaluate your thoughts. Are they more realistic now?
Step Six: Re-Evaluation
Knowing your rational thoughts, re-rate the negative feelings you established in Step Two.
Last Step: Outcome
Having completed the worksheet exercise, fill the circle which best describes how you feel now.
